channel.title: Buying a gaming rig
channel.description:
http://promotions.newegg.com/nepro/13-4251/index.html?icid=209233
Between the two cheaper ones, which on is better? I mean I prefer to save money, but if the i5 is that much better I'd go with it, however if it's the difference between anything loading in a 400th of a second vs a 500th of a second, I couldn't care less...
Also if you have any suggestions of putting something together in around a similar price range for more efficiency or cheaper for the same efficiency that would help.

item.title: Buying a gaming rig
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Thanks for the help, am definitely looking into all the things here with some potential modifications, price came out to $890. Might try to tone it down to $800, but again thanks, this is great. Will probably end up purchasing something very similar.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a gaming rig
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Since you have the OS i will not include it… This gaming rig is future proofed ( can run all the latest games incl crysis 3)
CPU: i5 4670k:
http://www.microcenter.com/product/413251/Core_i5_4670K_34GHz_Socket_LGA_1150_Boxed_Processor

amazon.com

Amazon.com: 2QX8541 - Intel Core i5 i5-4670K 3.40 GHz Processor - Socket H3 LGA-1150: Computers & Accessories

Intel Core i5 i5-4670K 3.40 GHz Processor - Socket H3 LGA-1150


http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819116899&nm_mc=AFC-C8Junction&cm_mmc=AFC-C8Junction--na--na--na&cm_sp=&AID=10446076&PID=3938566&SID=
CPU cooling: cooler master
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B005O65JXI/?tag=pcpapi-20
MotherBoard:
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00CRJS6OY/?tag=pcpapi-20
RAM(has refurbished deal):
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820233309&nm_mc=AFC-C8Junction&cm_mmc=AFC-C8Junction--na--na--na&cm_sp=&AID=10446076&PID=3938566&SID=
or if u wanna buy it all from amazon
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B009CIM9X2/?tag=pcpapi-20
HDD 1tb: caviarblack cuz of reviews but caviar blue is abit cheaper if you want to switch:
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0036Q7MV0/?tag=pcpapi-20
GFX card (7870 Ghz ed with 25 rebate with 2 free games!)
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814127722&nm_mc=AFC-C8Junction&cm_mmc=AFC-C8Junction--na--na--na&cm_sp=&AID=10446076&PID=3938566&SID=
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BANKXFI/?tag=pcpapi-20
Zalman case:
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811235038&nm_mc=AFC-C8Junction&cm_mmc=AFC-C8Junction--na--na--na&cm_sp=&AID=10446076&PID=3938566&SID=
CD/Dvd slot w/e:
http://pcpartpicker.com/part/lite-on-optical-drive-ihas124-04
Corsair PSU (430W, u can change to 500 or 600 if ud like but 430w is fine)
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817139049&nm_mc=AFC-C8Junction&cm_mmc=AFC-C8Junction--na--na-_-na&cm_sp=&AID=10446076&PID=3938566&SID=

item.title: Buying a gaming rig
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:3, topic:531991”]So you only want prebuilt?
I5 haswell is abit vague if its 4670k then 801 dollar build is abit better
8350 is still a really Big Bang for the buck
7790 is a faster card than 650 not sure how much the oc of 650 is tho
Also 1gb card vs 2gb card is the only main concern in this build
Both are fine builds but if u don’t mind building it ur self ill post a really decent 700$ build
Do u already have the OS or no[/quote]
Yea I’m just using Windows 7, what’s the $700 you recommend?

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a gaming rig
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

So you only want prebuilt?
I5 haswell is abit vague if its 4670k then 801 dollar build is abit better
8350 is still a really Big Bang for the buck
7790 is a faster card than 650 not sure how much the oc of 650 is tho
Also 1gb card vs 2gb card is the only main concern in this build
Both are fine builds but if u don’t mind building it ur self ill post a really decent 700$ build
Do u already have the OS or no

item.title: Buying a gaming rig
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

$800 for a pc with a 650 TI BOOST and 4670k cpu? Darn dude for retail you better get that… for that price you would normally be lucky to get a 650/7850
